docs.title: With Python Script
docs.text:
import markdown


text = """
# Title

Some text.

​```mermaid
graph TB
    A --> B
    B --> C
​```

Some other text.

​```mermaid
graph TB
    D --> E
    E --> F
​```
"""

html = markdown.markdown(text, extensions=["markdown_mermaid"])

print(html)

Expected output

<h1>Title</h1>
<p>Some text.</p>
<div class="mermaid">
graph TB
    A --> B
    B --> C
</div>

<p>Some other text.</p>
<div class="mermaid">
graph TB
    D --> E
    E --> F
</div>

<script type="module">
    import mermaid from 'https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/mermaid@11/dist/mermaid.esm.min.mjs';
    mermaid.initialize({ startOnLoad: true });
</script>

docs.title: Step 1. Fork this repository to your GitHub
Step 2. Clone the repository from your GitHub
Step 3. Add this repository to the remote in your local repository
docs.text:
git remote add upstream "https://github.com/Lee-W/markdown_mermaid"

You can pull the latest code in main branch through git pull upstream main afterward.

docs.title: Step 4. Check out a branch for your new feature
Step 5. Install prerequisite
docs.text:
python -m pip install pipx
python -m pipx install uv invoke
python -m pipx ensurepath
  • pipx: for python tool management
  • uv: for dependency management
  • invoke: for task management

docs.title: Step 6. Create your local Python virtual environment and install dependencies
Step 7. Work on your new feature
docs.text:
Note that this project follows conventional-commit and bumps version based on it. Use the following command to commit your changes.

inv git.commit

docs.title: Step 8. Run test cases
docs.text:
Make sure all test cases pass.

inv test

docs.title: Step 9. Run test coverage
docs.text:
Check the test coverage and see where you can add test cases.

inv test.cov

docs.title: Step 11. Run style check
docs.text:
Make sure your coding style passes all enforced linters.

inv style

docs.title: Step 12. Run security check
docs.text:
Ensure the packages installed are secure, and no server vulnerability is introduced

inv secure

docs.title: Step 13. Create a Pull Request and celebrate 🎉
